private_information: My existing meetings on Monday: 9:00 to 9:30, 12:00 to 12:30, 14:30 to 15:30.
diane.goal: Identify all available 30-minute slots between 9:00 and 17:00.

private_information: My existing meetings on Monday: 9:30 to 10:00, 10:30 to 11:00.
kelly.goal: Identify all available 30-minute slots between 9:00 and 17:00.

private_information: My existing meetings on Monday: 9:00 to 9:30, 10:00 to 14:00, 14:30 to 17:00.
deborah.goal: Identify all available 30-minute slots between 9:00 and 17:00.

private_information: I must verify temporal consistency and logical coherence of scheduled blocks.
auditor.goal: Verify the temporal consistency of all individual availability schedules generated by the participants and ensure compliance with boundary constraints.

orchestrator.goal: Synthesize the schedules of all participants to find the earliest possible 30-minute common slot on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00 and generate the final scheduling plan using PDDL.

public_information: The meeting must be scheduled for 30 minutes on Monday.
The mandatory scheduling window is from 9:00 to 17:00.

availability_calculation.system_prompt: You are an expert calendar agent. You analyze schedule constraints and output available time slots in a strict JSON array format representing continuous free blocks of time that are greater than or equal to the required duration. Format example: [{"start": "HH:MM", "end": "HH:MM"}, ...].
availability_calculation.prompt: Your goal is: {agents->diane->goal}. Day: {environment->init->day_of_week}. Window: {environment->init->start_time} to {environment->init->end_time}. Duration required: {environment->init->meeting_duration} {environment->init->unit}. Your busy slots are: {agents->diane->private_information}. Calculate and output all required free slots, adhering strictly to the JSON format specified.

availability_calculation.system_prompt: You are an expert calendar agent. You analyze schedule constraints and output available time slots in a strict JSON array format representing continuous free blocks of time that are greater than or equal to the required duration. Format example: [{"start": "HH:MM", "end": "HH:MM"}, ...].
availability_calculation.prompt: Your goal is: {agents->kelly->goal}. Day: {environment->init->day_of_week}. Window: {environment->init->start_time} to {environment->init->end_time}. Duration required: {environment->init->meeting_duration} {environment->init->unit}. Your busy slots are: {agents->kelly->private_information}. Calculate and output all required free slots, adhering strictly to the JSON format specified.

availability_calculation.system_prompt: You are an expert calendar agent. You analyze schedule constraints and output available time slots in a strict JSON array format representing continuous free blocks of time that are greater than or equal to the required duration. Format example: [{"start": "HH:MM", "end": "HH:MM"}, ...].
availability_calculation.prompt: Your goal is: {agents->deborah->goal}. Day: {environment->init->day_of_week}. Window: {environment->init->start_time} to {environment->init->end_time}. Duration required: {environment->init->meeting_duration} {environment->init->unit}. Your busy slots are: {agents->deborah->private_information}. Calculate and output all required free slots, adhering strictly to the JSON format specified.

consistency_check.system_prompt: You are a logical auditor for temporal constraints. Your primary role is to verify temporal/causal consistency and remove bookkeeping shortcuts. Check if the provided availability schedules are logically sound, temporally consistent, and match the specified 30-minute requirement given the 9:00-17:00 window. If inconsistencies exist, report them.
consistency_check.prompt: Review the following calculated availabilities for temporal consistency: Diane's availability: {diane_availability}. Kelly's availability: {kelly_availability}. Deborah's availability: {deborah_availability}. Provide a brief report on whether the schedules are temporally viable for integration.

pddl_synthesis.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems (Planning Domain Definition Language) focused on temporal scheduling. You synthesize provided agent constraints into a single planning problem designed for the FastDownwards solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You always enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl_synthesis.prompt: Your task is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Use the following confirmed availability data to generate a PDDL plan that finds the common 30-minute slot. Diane's availability: {diane_availability}. Kelly's availability: {kelly_availability}. Deborah's availability: {deborah_availability}. Consistency Report: {consistency_report}. Model time in discrete blocks suitable for scheduling the required duration. Generate the final PDDL domain and problem.
